pageContext.title: Honestbee raised around $49m since series A, with a Korean chaebol as a major backer
pageContext.content:
Photo credit: Honestbee

Honestbee, a Singapore-headquartered ecommerce startup, has raised around US$49 million since its series A round in 2015, according to its public filings that Tech in Asia obtained today. One of its biggest shareholder is Yesco, a subsidiary of LS Group, one of South Korea’s chaebols, or family-controlled industrial conglomerates.

LS Group is a diversified company engaging in machinery, electric systems, materials, liquified natural gas, and more. It made US$8.5 billion in revenue in 2017.

While Honestbee started out delivering groceries, it has expanded rapidly into other on-demand services like laundry, food, and tickets. It is available in eight countries in Asia. It is a top 10 food and drink app in five countries on both iOS and Android.

There are two legal entities related to Honestbee in Singapore. “A Honestbee Pte Ltd” has a total paid up capital of US$60.7 million while “Honestbee Pte Ltd” has US$3 million. It raised US$15 million for its series A round.

Another major shareholder in Honestbee is Brian Koo, whose family owns LS Group. Koo is also a founding member of Silicon Valley investment firm Formation 8. Honestbee co-founder and CEO Joel Sng was previously listed as a partner in the firm.

A filing by Yesco (in Korean) confirmed that it invested in A Honestbee. The deal was made around July 2017 and was worth around US$17.8 million.

A Honestbee Pte Ltd’s cap table is as follows:

Shareholder Number of shares Ownership
Yesco Co Ltd 90,953 41%
Kookmin Bank acting as trustee of WWG Global Private Equity Investment 64,144 29%
Brian Koo 31,875 14%
Hwaseung Enterprise 16,036 7%
Koo Enterprises 14,432 6%
Frame Investment Capital 3,465 2%
Finbold Limited 3,032 1%

Meanwhile, Sng owns 81 percent or 256,200 shares of Honestbee Pte Ltd. Board member Melissa Kwee owns 12 percent, and co-founder Isaac Tay owns two percent. Brian Koo owns one percent.

A Honestbee Pte Ltd’s 2017 financial statement shows that it has US$56 million due from Honestbee Pte Ltd in the form of convertible notes, a short-term loan, and reimbursement of interest payable.

Honestbee’s figures converted from Singapore dollars. US$1 = S$1.37. LS Group’s and Yesco’s numbers converted from Korean Won. US$1 = KRW 1,117.

Update on 26 September, 10:30am: The original story did not include US$3 million in paid-up capital as well as shareholder details from Honestbee Pte Ltd. That has been fixed.

seo.description: One of Honestbee’s biggest shareholders is LS Corp, which made US$8.5 billion in revenue in 2017.
